meanings.definition: Failing to provide support or motivation.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's unencouraging words made the student feel discouraged.
meanings.sent2: Her unencouraging attitude towards his dreams dampened his spirits.
meanings.sent3: The unencouraging cat refused to play with the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds cast an unencouraging shadow over the picnic.
meanings.sent5: The unencouraging silence in the room made everyone uneasy.

meanings.sent1: The unencouraging feedback from his boss left him feeling unappreciated.
meanings.sent2: The unencouraging response to her hard work was disheartening.
meanings.sent3: The unencouraging plant refused to bloom despite the care it received.
meanings.sent4: The unencouraging signs of progress made her doubt her abilities.
meanings.sent5: The unencouraging tone of the meeting made collaboration difficult.

meanings.sent1: The unencouraging news about the economy worried many people.
meanings.sent2: His unencouraging words did little to reassure the anxious crowd.
meanings.sent3: The unencouraging weather forecast dashed their plans for a picnic.
meanings.sent4: The unencouraging outlook on the project made everyone hesitant to proceed.
meanings.sent5: The unencouraging performance of the team left the coach disappointed.
